dialogues.speaker: Unknown

AGENT RANDY HULL comes into the lobby and motions to the man. He gets up and walks toward Hull, stopping at the operator's desk. The operator looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (CONT'D)

The man looks around the small office, noticing all the details: the wa are covered with framed citations, official plaques, and several framed newspaper articles on the capture of vario serial killers. There are several gory police photographs from case files taped on the side of a filing cabinet. The man wanders over to the desk which is littered with papers, pens, a few more case file photos, and one framed eight by ten glossy color photograph of a MAN in his twen standing next to a WOMAN in her late forties with graying brown hair. The man reaches for the photograph.

He is the man from the photograph except he is older now in his mid-thirties and has a hard, world-weary yet powerful look to him. He looks at the ambulance as he walks up the little concrete path to the building. Thunde rumbles off in the distance.

Along the walls of the room are enclosed offices with large glass windows. He strides down the hall. All of the offices are dark except for one Doyle looks at the lit office window and sees the back of man's head sitting inside. Hull sits at one of the desk cubicles. He looks up at Doyle from his computer.

dialogues.text: Yes sir. Doyle looks at the back of Fenton's head behind the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle comes in. The man, FENTON MEEKS, looks up at him fr his chair by the door, but doesn't get up. This is the fi time we actually see his face. He is in his late twenties with an easy smile and bright blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON

dialogues.text: Fenton Meeks. I have some information for you. Doyle just looks at him, waiting for him to continue.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares at him flatly, but he doesn't continue. They stare at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll bite. Who?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You haven't even heard me out yet, and already you doubt me. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Because in a case like this no one just walks into your office and tells you who the killer is. It doesn't work that way. .

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Sometimes truth defies reason Agent Doyle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah? That's pretty good. Youa philosopher Mr. Meeks?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: That right? FENTON _. Well, a pulp novelist really. Crime fiction.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE

dialogues.speaker: FENTON

dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, oh yeah. Thanks. He keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Everything alright? Want me to come in there with you?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: What? No, no. Everything's fine. He opens his office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle comes in. Fenton is still sitting in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Did my story check out? Doyle frowns at him, but nods.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So am I under arrest now? Doyle crosses to his desk and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You should be, but apparently the sheriff there is willing to forgive and forget as long as you bring the body and the ambulance back. No one wants to press charges.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (smiles) You've got to love smail towns.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not so sure the authorities in Tyler will feel the same way about you burying your brother in their public garden. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You know I get the distinct impression that you're playing some kind of game here with me.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Why would you go through all that trouble and then just walk in here and confess it to me?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I did it because I promised Adam I would. I'm here because I can't live with what I know anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: And what exactly do you know? Fenton nods to the picture of him and the woman.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That is your mother, isn't it? Doyle glances at the picture and then looks at Fenton for long moment, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I knew it. You can tell by the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Why are you so interested in my picture?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Curiosity I guess. It's the only personal picture you have in here. No family portraits, no snapshots of kids, just that one. Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I don't have a wife or kid. I'm too busy for that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Why not a more recent one of your mother then? Doyle looks at the picture for a long moment, a trace of sadness in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: My mother... died just a few weeks after this picture was taken.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well why don't we get back to your story. Why do you think your brother was the God's Hand killer?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I know it was him.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: It started back in Tyler near the summer of seventy-nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a beautiful, sunny day. The townspeople go slowly about their business, nodding or waving at one another as they pass. A little yellow school bus goes down the stree and pulls over. Children burst out of the bus door. Two boys, ADAM AGE NINE and FENTON AGE TWELVE, break away fro the rest of the children and walk away from the town. The resemblance between them is apparent, though Fenton is ta

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sings) I got the joy joy joy joy down in my heart! He looks to Fenton and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're supposed to say where.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't want to sing that dumb song. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zt.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You don't have to sing. Just say where.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (sighs) Where.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Not now! I'll point to you when it's time. (sings) I got the joy, joy, joy, joy down in my heart! (points)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Where?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smiles) Down in my heart! (points again)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a Down in my heart to staaay! And if the devil doesn't like it he can sit on a tack! (points)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No! You're supposed to say ouch now! I'll start again. I got the... They turn down a road with a big banner hanging across it that reads, "Tyler Rose Garden”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down a little cement path that runs through the huge and sprawling gardens. .

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We lived right behind the Tyler Municipal Rose Garden... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Every rose imaginable is in bloom around them. Adam chase a butterfly as he sings his song. They walk off the path a wire fence at the back of the garden. On the other side of the fence is a small graveled road that runs from arou the garden to an old wood and brick house.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .in the house where they used to keep the gardeners back in the fifties. Dad got a good deal on it back when he and mom got married. They climb the fence and head toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits on the floor in the living room watching Banana Splits on television.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Adam was three years younger than me. Our mom died giving birth to him so I basically took care of him ever since I can remember. Fenton is in the kitchen, preparing dinner.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Our dad worked as a mechanic over in Chandler at a Ford dealership. He usually got home around five thirty and we'd all have dinner together. DAD comes into the kitchen. It is the same man from the picture in Adam's suicide scene. He is in his mid-to-late forties with thinning dark hair. He puts his lunchbox dow on the table and smiles at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey kiddo. Something sure smells good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Fenton, and Dad all sit around the kitchen table, putting food on their plates from various bowls and plate Adam piles peas on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (to Adam) Whoa there tiger. Save some for us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I love peas!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: {laughs) You must. Dad takes the bowl from him and puts it back on the table

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better be careful though. You might - turn into one if you're not careful. Adam giggles and puts a big spoonful of peas in his mouth

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Fenton) So how'd you do on that math test?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (looks down) I barely passed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I never was any good at math either. Shoot, I still can't do anything without a calculator.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But I've got another test next week, and it's going to.be even harder.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Oh don't sound so gloomy about it. We'll sit down this weekend and see if we can't figure that junk out together, alright? Fenton smiles at him and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two single beds with a little nightstand betwee them. On Adam's side of the room there is a Pete's Dragon poster and a toy box. There is a Farah Fawcett poster and one of the Dallas Cowboy's 1978 team on Fenton's side. Ad is already laying in his bed, playing with a couple of St Wars figures. Fenton changes into his bed clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey Fenton, can we go see Meatballs after school tomorrow? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fenton climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You've already seen it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I want to see it again.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: We're going to see Alien.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We can't. It's rated R. Dad comes in.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Teeth all brushed? They both nod.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure about that Adam? Adam nods emphatically. Dad goes to his bed and leans dow

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Breath test time. Adam breathes on him. He cringes dramatically and falls o the bed as if he has died. Fenton breaks up laughing. Ada shakes Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I did brush them! Dad opens his eyes and laughs. He lifts up and puts an ar around Adam.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm just yolking with you egghead. He gives him a squeeze, and kisses him on the forehead. H stands and looks over at Fenton, who rolis over.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry Fenton. I know you're too big for a goodnight kiss. Fenton rolls back over and smiles at him. He reaches down and tousles Fenton's hair. He clicks off the lamp between the beds. A night-light still shines next to the lamp on the wall. Dad sees it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {to Fenton) Aren't you too big for a nightlight \ too?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Adam likes it on.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No I don’t. You do.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (guiltily) I don't like it too dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: 1 (smiles) 1 Well goodnight boys. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Don't let the bed bugs bite!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That's right. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Love you too.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Goodnight Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out and shuts the door, leaving it cracked. lifts up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I want to see Meatballs.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You can see Meatballs and I'll see Alien.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (whines) But I don't like to watch movies by myself.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (sighs) Alright. Just go to bed. Adam smiles and lays back down. Fenton lays there staring up at the ceiling, slowly drifting off.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was our family. Just the three of us. All of Mom and Dad's relatives had died off. There was no one but us left. We didn't mind though. We didn't need anyone else. We were happy together... He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton's eyes snap open. The lights are on. Dad is standi between their beds in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (excited) Come on, wake up. Adam lifts up, confused and tired.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Get up boys. I've got something to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Dad sits down on Fenton's bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Come over here Adam. Adam gets up and gets on the bed with them.

dialogues.speaker: , DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to wake up and listen to me. Are you awake? They both look sleepy, but they nod. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you both. You know that don't you? They both look confused, but they nod again.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need you both to listen to me very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad is laying in bed, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He said he'd had a vision that night. The room slowly fills with light from an unseen source. D opens his eyes and sees the room washed with light. A fig comes out of the light, moving slowly toward Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A vision from God. The figure reaches the bed and Dad sees that it is a beau ANGEL straight out of a Botticelli painting.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: An angel came to him and told him the truth of this world... The angel reaches out and touches Dad's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And revealed God's special purpose for our family... The room disappears into swirling darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam sit on the bed staring at Dad with a mixt of disbelief and awe.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: We are near the end of the world here boys. I know it's crazy, but the angel showed me. There are demons among us. The devil has released them for the final battle. It's being fought now, but no one knows it, except us and others like us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'm scared Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad puts an arm around him and pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be afraid of tiger. God has chosen us. He's given us jobs to do. We don't fear demons; we destroy them. We pick'em out one ! by one and pitch'em out of this world. This is God's purpose for us. The ! angel called us God's hands. Adam thinks about this. Fenton just stares at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ' ADAM
dialogues.text: ' So we're like super-heroes?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Exactly. A family of super-heroes. We're gonna help save the world. Dad and Adam are excited. Fenton is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But Dad, that's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I know it sounds that way, but it's the God's honest truth son. I wouldn't lie to you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So what are our super-powers?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: We can see the demons while others can't. Plus the angel told me God would send us three weapons to destroy the demons with.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Magical weapons!?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I imagine so. Adam's face lights up with excitement. Fenton just stares numbly at his father, his eyes glazing over in shock. ADAM . When do we get them? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I don't know son. The angel just said soon. I don't know anymore than what I've just told you except that we can't tell anyone about this. The angel was pretty clear on that. If we tell anyone, we put them and ourselves in danger. The angel said God was watching us, that certain Stars are like cameras that transmit everything we do straight to God. Isn't that neat? Adam nods enthusiastically. Fenton just stares off in spa Dad notices his expression.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it's hard to swallow Fenton. I wanted to wait to tell you once I had it all figured out myself, but the angel said I had to wake you up and tell you now. Fenton doesn't seem to hear him or see him, he is ina complete daze.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (concerned) Fenton? Hey, look at me...Fenton?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to say or how to feel. It was too crazy and messed up to understand or even acknowledge. I didn't realize it at that moment, at least not consciously, but my happy and mostly secure world had just been flipped over and there were dark things under there. Very dark things. And my little boy's mind just couldn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Adam! Fenton! Fenton's eyes snap open. He lifts up and looks around, registers where he is. Sunlight streams into the room. Adam is still asleep, clutching his Princess Leia figure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Up and at'em boys. Fenton pulls back the covers as Dad appears in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiles at Fenton) Morning kiddo. He goes to Adam's bed and shakes his leg. DAD (CONT'D) 7” C'mon lazy bones. Adam stirs and mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, it's late. We overslept. Fenton just stares at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Snap to it boys and get dressed. The bus has come and gone and that means I'm taking you to school. So get a move on it. He heads out the door. Fenton stares after him, and then looks over at Adam as he lifts up. Adam yawns and they lo at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? Fenton snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad is driving with Adam-next to him-and Fenton next to t window. The boys eat toast as Dad drives. Patsy Cline's Walking After Midnight Plays softly on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: None of us mentioned it. It was only a dream, a nightmare. Nothing that crazy could be real. Everything was okay, just like before. The truck pulls into the school parking lot. Dad puts it park and looks over at his sons. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, have a good day at school. Fenton opens the door to get out.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And remember not to tell anyone what I told you last night. Fenton freezes. Adam pushes him out, and gets out himself

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We won't Dad. Bye! He shuts the door and Dad drives away. Adam walks off tow the school, leaving Fenton standing in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEACHER talks as she writes math equations on the chalkboard. Fenton sits at his desk, watching her with he eyes, trying not to fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I refused to believe it. It was just a dream. That whole next week was just a dream too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton is in the kitchen preparing dinner. Adam sits at t table, drawing with crayons.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like when Dad started bringing home the magical weapons. Dad comes in excited, holding an ordinary wood-handle axe and an old pair of work gloves. He talks excitedly to Fen and Adam, gesturing with the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives down a country road. It is overcast outside.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He was on his way to work... There is an old broken down farmhouse ahead.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When God called to hin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly a beam of light appears out of the sky and shine behind the farmhouse. Dad slows down and pulls over acros from it. He gets out of the truck and walks toward the si of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad walks up the dirt path around the house and sees a pi of rotted wood. There stuck in the middle of one of the logs is an axe with a pair of old work gloves next to it. The light shines on them from the heavens above. “BACK TO SCENE: INT. HOUSE -- EVENING Dad and Adam smile excitedly at one another. Adam reaches out and touches the axe blade in awe.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (looks at the gloves) I still don't understand what these are for though. Fenton turns away and busies himself in the kitchen. Dad notices him and looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher talks and writes on the chalkboard. Fenton si at his desk, his eyes closing and opening sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Just a long long dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam sit on the couch, watching Mork and Mindy television. Dad comes in with a piece of lead pipe and gestures with it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (excitedly) We got'em all! Won't be long now. The angel came again last night and told me that God will send us a list of our first seven demons soon. Adam jumps up to look at the new weapon. Fenton looks awa and stares at the television set.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once we finish the first list another will come, and then another and (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: another for the rest of our lives or until all the demons have been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeaaa!! Fenton just stares at the television without emotion.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't real. It couldn't be. I just had to wait it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton washes dishes. Dad sits at the table smoking a cigarette. He watches Fenton, but Fenton ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Come over here a minute Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm washing dishes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: They can wait. Come here. I want to talk to you. Fenton reluctantly stops and dries his hands on a towel. goes to the table and sits down. He stares down at his ha Dad looks at him and takes a deep drag off of his cigaret

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (exhales) Fenton, I know you've had some problems adjusting to everything that's happened this week, and I'm sorry son. I really am, but God has willed it, and we have to obey God.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But maybe you just think He did or dreamed it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: He did. I wouldn't lie to you son. -

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But maybe you're...you're not right in the head Dad. Maybe you need help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: s

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (smiles) It happened Fenton. God sent an angel to me. It's true. I'm not crazy. You'll see that soon. That's what I wanted to talk to you about. I have the first list now. He pulls it out of his shirt pocket, unfolds it, and plac it in front of Fenton. There are seven names on it. The first one is CYNTHIA HARBRIDGE. Fenton looks at it and th up at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is jacked up with Dad underneath it, working on it.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The angel came to him while he was at work. He is working when suddenly blackness washes over everyth The Angel's beautiful face floats in front of him. The Angel's hand reaches out of the darkness and touches his forehead, and then the darkness recedes and everything go back to normal. He pushes himself out from underneath the car, lifts up, pulls a small notepad and a pen out of his breast pocket, and furiously begins to scribble names on it. He stops an looks at the names he's written. There are seven of them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Fenton just stares at Dad as though he's lost his mind.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (frightened) But these are people's names.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yep and they'll look like people too, but they're really demons. Fenton looks at him with horror.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The angel said when I lay my hands on them, I'll reveal them for what they truly are. That's what the gloves are for. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got to get them and bring them back here with the gloves on. Once they're here, I take the gloves off and reveal them. You'll see, then you'll believe. He smiles at Fenton. Fenton just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher talks as she writes on the chalkboard. Fenton sits at his chair, trying not to doze off.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The dream had finally ended. It was all real. My father was insane. He was going to murder someone. He had never been a violent man. I'd never seen him hit anyone, much less me or Adam. He didn't even own a gun. But I knew he was going to kill someone... He finally rests his head on his arms and closes his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton lifts up and screams. The whole class turns and lo at him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And I had to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton lays on the grass, reading the bible.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The obvious answer was to tell someone what he was planning, but I couldn't do that. I loved him even if he'd gone crazy. I had to save him from himself. If he thought it was God that told him to do this awful thing then I had to prove to him that it wasn't God. That it had to be the devil. So I studied the bible looking for something to fight him with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “FU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad is laying in his recliner, reading a book. Adam is la in front of the television watching The Love Boat. Fenton comes in, carrying a bible. Dad looks up at him. Fenton opens the bible and reads.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death. He looks up at Dad. Dad just looks back at him for a mome

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Proverbs?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Yep. Verse 14. Line 12.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Huh. Can I see that? Fenton hands him the bible. Dad takes it, looks at it for moment, and then hands it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Read line 32. Fenton takes it, finds the line and reads it aloud.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: When calamity comes, the wicked are brought down, but even in death the righteous have refuge. Adam turns away from the television and listens to them.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You think this is wrong and you're trying to prove it. I respect that son, I do, but calamity has come. The end of the world is near and it is our jobs to bring the wicked down. God will take care of us because we are the righteous. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But Dad what would the Baptists say? We are still Baptists aren't we? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, before that angel came to me, I wasn't so sure I really believed os in God. I just wasn't sure. God : was something far away, that didn't exist everyday in my life or at least I couldn't see it. I went to church more or less out of habit than for spiritual reasons. But now I know, I really know that God exists. He is here with us right now. We're beyond religion. We've got a direct line to God.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Does that mean we don't have to go to church anymore?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It sure does.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeaaa! Fenton looks disappointed, but doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad sits on the ground, pulling weeds out of the flower b in front of the house. Fenton walks up next to him and ge a drink of water from the hose. He wipes his mouth and lo over at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What about thou shalt not kill Dad? Dad sighs and stops what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: This isn't killing. This is destroying demons. Now get out there and finish mowing that yard.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But what about be careful battling monsters lest ye become one? Dad stops what he's doing and looks at Fenton, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Shoot Fenton, that's pretty good. I like that. I'm gonna keep that one in mind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He goes back to pulling weeds.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now get out there and finish that lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton studies the bible while the other children eat and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There wasn't much in the old testament to use. Actually there was more in there to support Dad's case than mine. All kinds of gruesome stuff going on back then in the name of God. The new testament, with the exception of Revelations of course, was where all the real ammo was. When I found Jesus back there I knew it was going to be alright. I finally had Dad beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Dad sit at the table. Fenton looks up from the bible in front of him at Dad. They just look at each othe for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Fenton. Everything you just said is absolutely right and ‘true. Fenton smiles proudly and Dad smiles back at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it only applies to humans son, not to demons. Fenton's smile falls away and Dad lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you for all this bible reading though. You've got determination that's for sure. You get to Revelations yet? : Fenton doesn't say anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You tell me when you do cause I never could understand half of it, but I figure I should. Maybe we could figure it out together. Adam comes into the kitchen with a piece of manilla paper

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey Dad look. I got a list too. He hands it to Dad, who looks at it. There are seven name written on it in crayon. The first name is Billy Dobbs.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this Adam?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (proudly) God gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (looks at the list) Isn't Billy Dobbs the kid who was picking on you last week at school?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (nods) He's a demon. Dad looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Adam, tell the truth. You made this list up yourself didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, God...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (sternly) Adam. Tell the truth. Adam looks down at his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here. Adam climbs into his lap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't just make something like that up son. We destroy demons. If we used your list, we wouldn't be destroying demons, we'd be killing people. And we must never do that. Destroying demons is a good thing, but killing people is a very bad thing. Do you understand? Adam looks ashamed, but nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (hugs him) . It's alright, you've just got to be patient. God will send you your own list when you're older. Fenton looks at Adam and Dad with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I had tried to fight him with God, but God had forsaken me. The only thing left to do was to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton stands in front of the station, looking at it and pacing back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: But that was easier said than done. I stood out there for almost an hour, wrestling with myself. Could I really send my Dad to prison or an insane asylum? What if the police didn't believe me? After all it was a pretty unbelievable situation. And if they didn't, what would Dad do to me when he found out? A POLICE OFFICER comes out of the station and nods at Fen Fenton nods back and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark outside. Fenton and Adam sit at the kitchen ta finishing dinner. There is an empty plate at the table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That was the last day of school and Dad had promised to take us to the movies that night, but he didn't come home from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton gets up, takes the empty plate, fills it with food and puts it in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lays in his bed. Fenton turns off the light and gets into his bed. Adam lifts up and looks over at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: When's Dad coming home?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't know. Adam lays back.

dialogues.speaker: , ADAM
dialogues.text: You think he's destroying a demon?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That's all make believe Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No it's not, it's...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (lifts up) Listen to me. None of that demon junk is real. Dad just made it up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: He did too. Just like Santa Claus. Adam frowns. An old wound has been exposed.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You remember last Christmas when you caught Dad putting our presents under the tree don’t you? Adam's frown deepens and he nods.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just like that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Adam looks unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : Adam, have I ever lied to you? Adam thinks about this for a moment and then shakes his h

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. I haven't, but Dad has. You've got to trust me now Adam. I'm telling you the truth. Dad' sick. Demons do not exist. Those names on Dad's list are real people. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But why would he make it up?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I think we should leave. Adam thinks about this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You mean run away?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: aa (nods) Mca Would you go with me?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don't want to leave Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Neither do I, but we might have to.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why? Fenton stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Dad's going to kill somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Fenton are both asleep. Headlights from the wind wash the room with light for a moment and then disappear. Fenton wakes up. Outside an engine IDLES for a moment and then shuts off. A truck door OPENS and then SHUTS. Fenton gets up and goes to the window. He sees Dad's silhouette, carrying something over his shoulder toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys RATTLE in the front door. Fenton peeks around the co of the hallway. The door opens, revealing Dad. He reaches in and turns on the front hall light switch next to the d He sees Fenton watching hin.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey there kiddo. (motions to him) Come over here and help me. Dad turns back to something on the porch. Fenton walks to him and looks past him to the porch. He sees a WOMAN layi there, her mouth covered with duct tape, her eyes wide wi fear and tears streaming down her face. Fenton freezes, staring at the woman. He notices dried blood in her hair and on her forehead. Dad bends down, picks her up, and carries her inside the house. Her hands and feet are tied

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Fenton) Shut the door. Fenton moves forward slowly, eyeing the woman in his fath arms, and shuts the door. Dad carries her into the living room and puts her down on the couch. Fenton comes in and looks at her and then at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad? Dad and Fenton turn and look at Adam who is standing in t hallway in his pajamas rubbing his eyes. Adam sees the wo

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (looks at her grimly) That's a demon, Son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad is standing in front of a car with an opened hood, wo on it.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: God came to him earlier that day at work and told him that the time had come. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He suddenly stops what he's doing and goes to a shelf in corner of the garage and pulls out several phonebooks. He flips through one until he finds a name. He pulls out his list from his pocket and looks at the first name on it, CYNTHIA BARTLETT, and then over at the phonebook where he name, address, and phone number is printed. He tears the page out of the book, stuffs it in his pocket, and goes b to work on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: After work he drove down to Jacksonville, about 45 minutes or so southwest of Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives slowly down a run-down residential street.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He said he'd never been there before, but he had no problem finding it. God was leading him. He cuts the headlights, pulls the truck over on the side the street, and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the house across the street. It's lights are on, and there is the faint sound of music playing. He put on the gloves and pulls out the lead pipe from his back p as he walks toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad goes to the front door, holding the lead pipe behind back, and is about to knock when the door opens and Cynth comes out, carrying her purse. She shuts the door behind her and locks it, never noticing Dad standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Cynthia Bartlett?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: (turns startled) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad comes out of the backdoor carrying the woman over his shoulder, with Adam right behind him. Fenton follows afte them reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (calls quietly to him) Come on. It's alright. He leads them to the tool shed near the back fence. It is one of those big red aluminum sheds from Sears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad puts the woman down on the dirt floor of the shed. Ad stands looking at her curiously. Fenton lingers in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (to Fenton) Come in and shut the door. He does as he is told. Dad goes to his work bench where there is a little shelf that holds the axe. He takes the lead pipe out of his back pocket and puts it on the shelf and turns to his sons. Adam looks excited, but unsure. Fenton looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here boys. Adam goes to him, but Fenton comes to him reluctantly. He puts one arm around Adam and one around Fenton, and turns them both toward the woman on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That may look like a woman, but it's not. That is a demon. The woman looks up at them with tears in her eyes, and tr to say something from behind the tape on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They all look like humans, just like her. But inside they are murderous - beasts... . Fenton and Adam look at the woman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-here to destroy the entire human race. And it is up to us, our family, to destroy them. It is God's will. When I put my hands on her, you will see the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad pulls off his gloves and takes down the axe from the shelf. Fenton looks terrified. Adam looks mostly curious.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Dad, don't do this! Dad holds the axe and looks at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I love you with all my heart Fenton. If I could spare you this I would. But this is God's will and we are His servants. Don't be afraid, Son. You'll understand when I touch her. ' He moves toward the terrified woman. He bends down and extends his free hand toward her. Fenton watches him, paralyzed with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares at Fenton incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Why would I make it up?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Where's your father now?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Dead. Doyle sits there, thinking about what he’s just heard. Th door opens and Hull sticks his head in the office. Doyle looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Thinking about heading out. (glances at Fenton) Unless you need me to stay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: No. No. You go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Alright, see you later. Doyle waves and nods absentmindedly, and Hull leaves. Doy looks at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So he killed that woman? Right there in front of you? Fenton nods.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But not to his way of thinking. He hadn't killed a woman. He had destroyed a demon. You see, he believed that when he touched her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad reaches out and touches Cynthia. Her eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .--he revealed her sins...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--and the demon within her. Adam screams and recoils from her. Dad takes his hand off of Cynthia with disgust, and raises the axe. Fenton watch Dad‘in horror and screams as he brings the axé down.

dialogues.speaker: FB.
dialogues.text: ! Ft |

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Revealed her sins?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That's what he claimed.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (whistles softly) Believe me I've heard all kinds of crazy stuff, but that's a first. What ‘did you do? . '

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What could I do? I watched him kill her and then I watched him bury her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in the back of the garden, away from the garden proper. Dad digs a hole near a lone rosebush while Adam sits on the ground, holding the flashlight for him. There are three holes in the ground, forming a circle, and thre black trash bags laying on the ground. Fenton sits next t Adam, staring at the bags, crying. Dad finishes the last hole and picks up one of the trash bags. Adam gets up and picks up one too. He throws the bag inside one of the hol

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: No Adam. Do it like this. He reaches down and pulls the bag out of the hole, opens and dumps the contents into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got to do this right boys. The angel was real specific. ADAM. Why do we have to bury them in three different holes? DAD . That's the way God wants it done. We cut them at the neck and the waist and then bury'em out here. That's all I was told.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why out here? (CONFINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo,

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: God chose it just like he chose us I suppose. Dad looks over at Fenton, sees him crying. He goes to him and puts an arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't cry Fenton. It's alright. She wasn't human. Didn't you see that when I touched her? Fenton shakes his head no and tries to hold in his sobs, few escaping him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I saw it Dad. Dad smiles and winks at him and he smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You...You killed her... He cries harder.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I didn't kill her son. She was a demon. I don't understand why you didn't see it. You were supposed to see the truth just like we did. Dad looks over at the black trashbags.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I wasn't so sure I could do it myself. I mean she looked like a woman to me too, but after I touched her all I could see was the demon. And I just had to destroy it. That's what seeing it did to me. I'm sorry you didn't see it. : (gets up) I don't understand why though. But there's always next time.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You're going to do it again?! DAD . This is our job now son. We're God's hands. You've got to accept that. We've started something we've got to finish. There's thousands... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You can't! I won't let you!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You can't stop it. We're doing God's wor...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'll tell! Dad's face goes dark, and he grabs Fenton by the arn.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: If you do, someone will die. Maybe even you. The angel was clear on that. Do you understand? Fenton cries and tries to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Answer me! Do you understand!?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (cries) Yes! Dad lets go of him, and looks ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's just...I love you. I don't want you to get hurt or get anyone else hurt. You'll understand soon. I promise. But until then you have to promise me you won't tell. Fenton doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sternly) Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I..pr..pr..promise. He reaches down and tousles his hair, though Fenton jumps little at his touch. Dad frowns at his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You'd better keep that promise. Remember, God is watching you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dad goes back to the hole and begins to fill it with dirt Fenton looks up at the stars fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So you didn't tell? Fenton shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I should have, but I was afraid. I loved my father, but I was terrified of him. He was a murderer. “How could I know how far it went? Doyle looks lost in thought. He glances at the picture of his mother. Fenton studies him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So now do you understand why I think my brother is the God's Hand killer?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (rubs his eyes) I suppose. But then again what you've described happened to you both. So it could be you just as much as him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But I didn't believe Agent Doyle. Adam did. That night I saw my father kill a woman with a hand axe, but Adam saw him destroy a demon. No matter what I tried to tell him, he still believed Dad. To him we were knights of God on a holy mission to abolish evil. -Doyle thinks about this for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Do you have any physical proof?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I read in the paper that only one of the bodies of the six victims had been found. Is that true? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oN 5S.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You read it in the paper didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That doesn't make it true.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Well in this case it does. The first victim was found mutilated with a note saying that God's hand had taken him. With all the others, only notes were found. No bodies.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: How do you know they're dead then?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: We don't for sure. But the first note told us we wouldn't find any bodies from then on. It said he wanted to keep them.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I've got a pretty good idea where the bodies are.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: The Rose Garden?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (nods) There were other holes out where I buried him. Some of them looked freshly covered.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me that to begin with!? He jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Would you have believed me? Doyle gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle and Fenton walk through the lobby. The operator gla up at them from her book and then continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is raining lightly. Fenton and Doyle walk quickly out Doyle's car. Doyle reaches into his back, pulls out a set of handcuffs, and tosses them to Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: There's something about you I don't trust. Everything you've told me so far is screwy. It may be the truth like you say, and if it is I'll apologize later, but for now you put'em on or I'll put'em on you. Fenton puts the cuffs on as Doyle opens the backdoor of t car. Fenton starts to get in. Doyle reaches out to help him, but Fenton recoils.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I've got it. Doyle backs off, lets him get in, and then shuts the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle drives. Fenton sits in the back. There is a metal cage divider between them. Doyle looks at him in the rear mirror and then back at the road.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So tell me something. Why did you wait so long to come forth?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I didn't even know about the case until three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: That's impossible. It's been all over the news for the past few months.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't watch the news or read newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You just told me that you'd read an article on it in the paper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I did. I happened to see the headline “ three days ago. God's hand claims ae sixth victim. I bought the paper and called Adam, but he wasn't there. I left a message and he called me back that next night.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You knew and you left a message?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I didn't know for sure. I suspected.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: No, you knew. Admit it. You knew and you didn't tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm telling you now. They drive in silence for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You have to admit it's all a pretty big coincidence. I mean, the day after you just happen to notice that there is a killer on the loose, who you know is your own brother, he kills himself.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm telling you the truth. He was the killer.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I'm just saying it's a pretty hard tale to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Yeah, and so was the one I told you when I first came into your office. But it was true, wasn't it? Doyle looks at him in the rearview and then back at the r

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lies are always easy to.believe Agent Doyle. It's the truth that's hard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I still can't understand how you oo could keep something like that in 2 for so long.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: We all have secrets. Don't we Agent Doyle? Tell me, how did your mother die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘ Doyle looks up sharply at him in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: What did you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You told me she died after that picture was taken. But there was something about the way you...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: My mother is none of your damn... Doyle catches himself, though he grips the wheel angrily. Fenton doesn't say anything. Doyle coldly watches the windshield wipers wiping away at the rain. om, DOYLE (CONT'D) eon My mother was...murdered. Senselessly “ butchered by some whacked out killer like your Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to pry.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I don’t like to talk about it, but it's not a secret.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Forget it. They drive along for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Did they ever catch her killer?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Nope. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Is that why you took this job?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Something like that. You know, you're pretty good at this. Ever think of becoming a cop?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: When I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You've got the instincts for it. But I've got them too and mine are telling me you're hiding something from me.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What do you think I'm hiding?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure yet, but my instincts are hardly ever wrong. So why don't you finish your story and I'll see if I can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam sit in the living room watching Good Time on television. Adam laughs at the television, but Fenton just sits staring at it, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: After that night, I guess you'd expect Dad to set out to teach us murder like most Texans teach their children racism. But nothing happened. Dad didn't mention it anymore, and neither did Adam. After a couple of weeks I began to think it was over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam swim in the water with the other CHILDREN

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I know it sounds silly and childish that I could actually think that after what I had seen, but I wanted it to be over. I wanted to go back to being a normal kid again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Fenton play basketball with a group of BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And I did. I buried the whole thing down deep, and pretended that it had never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton tosses and turns in his sleep. -

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Of course there were still the nightmares. He raises up, sweating and crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam sit on the bank, skipping rocks on the wa Fenton lays back on the ground and looks up at the clouds

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But they came less and less often after awhile. They always say children are resilient creatures and I was proof. Once a full month had gone by I had completely convinced myself that it was over and everything was going to be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is going down. Fenton, Adam, and another boy Fent age, ERIC, walk away from the court to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You see Dukes of Hazard last night? Fenton and Adam nod.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You remember when Daisy bent over!? Fenton nods, smiling, and Adam looks a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I like Boss Hogg. He's funny. Fenton and Eric pointedly ignore him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Man, I'd do anything to really see her tits.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Om! You said...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (mildly) Shut-up Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (to Fenton) You want to spend the night tonight? We can wrap Corey's house.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (smiles and nods) I'll have to ask my dad though.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: My mom can call and ask if you want.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: See you in a little bit. Eric runs off to one of the houses off of the sidewalk. Adam and Fenton keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What's wrap mean? Fenton looks at his little brother and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll race you. They take off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam laugh as they run down’ the road by the R Garden. Adam turns into the drive of the Garden, and Fent stops running and stays on the road. Adam notices that Fe has stopped running.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Come on! Fenton looks at the entrance to the Garden wearily. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm going around on the road. Adam walks back to Fenton and goes with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam walk up the road in front of their house, looking inquisitively at the new white Chevy Van parked i the driveway. The lights in the house are on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam walk into the house.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In the kitchen! Adam takes off through the house to the kitchen, with Fen following behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. sits at the kitchen table with a notepad and few phonebooks in front of him. He flips through one of the phonebooks. Adam comes in, followed by Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Who's van is that? Fenton sees the phonebooks, and then the notepad with sev names written on it, one of them crossed out. He looks at Dad with absolute horror. Dad looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Ours. Ain't it a beaut? (to Fenton) Your friend's mom just called. I told her not tonight. We've got some work to do in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's van is parked on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad sits behind the wheel, watching the entrance of a hou down the street, while Fenton sits in the passenger seat, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: wearing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's Angels t-shirt, and Adam sits in the back drinking a Dr. Pepper. Aman in his late thirties, EDWARD MAXS, comes out of the

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dad told us that there were moments in everyone's life when they could just suddenly disappear without anyone knowing where they went or why. house, and Dad tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: There he is. Edward goes to his car in the driveway and gets in. backs out pulls the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's car pulls into the parking lot, parks, and he ge s van pulls into the parking lot and takes the of the driveway. Dad waits a moment, and then van out, and follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He said those were the moments when God's hands could reach out and take you.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: spot right next to Edward's car. out. Dad'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, Adam, Adam nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Fenton watch Edward disappear into the mall.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What do we do now Dad?

dialogues.speaker: . DAD
dialogues.text: We wait. We'll get him when he comes out. Just like I told you. Remember? Fenton doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fenton?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I can't do this Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Can't never could do anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bea

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I can do it Dad. Dad smiles at him in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: . DAD
dialogues.text: You sure can tiger.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But, what if someone sees us?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: They won't. \ ‘

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But it’s daylight.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I told you God will blind them for us. Remember? Fenton nods, but still looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the day God chose, Son. It is His will. There's nothing to worry about. As long as we do His will, He'll protect us and help us.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But what if he doesn't? What if...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You've got to have faith Fenton. You've got to just let go and trust Him or at least trust me. Fenton nods again, but without conviction.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you still don't understand it Fenton, but we've got to do this. It's our job. I know you're going to see the demon this time.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But I don't want to Dad. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be afraid of. God will protect you. You just have to accept Him. Come on, bow your head and we'll pray together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dad and Adam bow their heads and close their eyes. Fenton bows his head, but keeps his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God please speak to Fenton and show him your will. Give him the courage to serve you and the strength to be your servant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton looks nervously over at the mall entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad reads a book. Adam plays with his Star Wars figures i the back of the van. Fenton just stares at the mall entra FENTON (V.0.) ¢ I know Dad's abductions may seem really simple, but those were simpler times. Nowadays you'd have to concoct some elaborate scheme to abduct someone. People expect psychos around every corner now. But back then they didn't expect it as much. Of course according to Dad nothing, not even a camera, could catch us anyway. We were invisible when we were God's Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward comes out of the entrance carrying a shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton tenses up at the sight of Edward. He looks over at Dad, who is still reading his book, and then looks back a Edward who is walking toward them in the distance. He wal out into the parking lot. Fenton tries to breathe easy. H looks back at Dad, but Dad has looked up and is staring r at Edward. i

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Here he comes boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits up and looks excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now remember what I told you. Dad puts on his gloves and reaches in between the seats a grabs the lead pipe from the floorboard. Fenton stares at the pipe in Dad's gloved hand with horror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: et

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (looks up at Dad) I don't want to do this Dad. Dad looks at him and the disappointment is obvious, and t he looks back at Edward who is getting closer by the seco

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (sternly) This isn't about what you want, Son. You just do like I told you and | everything will be fine. Now c'mon. _ |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad opens his door, puts a leg out, but notices that Fent isn't moving.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on Fenton. He stares at Dad with tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yes you can, now move. Fenton hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sternly) Do what I tell you. Fenton gets out of the van in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton sees Edward walking right toward him. He gets down on his knees and looks under Edward's car. Edward walks u and sees Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: C'mon...Trixie. Get out...from under...there

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing boy? Fenton looks up at Edward with tears streaming down his f

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: My...my...dog's under there...and... and...he...he...won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bs. CONTINUED: bo. Edward bends down to him, revealing Dad behind him with t lead pipe raised. Fenton closes his eyes tight as Dad bri the pipe down on Edward's head. Edward crumples to the ground, falling on Fenton. The van door rolls open, revea Adam, who hoots in delight at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You got him! You got him! Dad grabs hold of Edward's legs and pulls him off of Fent

dialogues.speaker: DAD -
dialogues.text: (to Fenton) Help me get him in the van. Fenton sits on the ground with his eyes still shut tight, shaking with sobs. Dad sighs and grabs Edward by the wais and lifts him by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives along in silence. Fenton's crying has tapered off, but hasn't completely stopped. Adam wraps Edward's hands together with an enormous amount of duct tape as he lays unconscious on the floorboard in the back. His feet are already taped together with an even thicker wad of ta Dad looks back at Adam in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That's good Adam. Don't waste tape.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You sure? What if he gets loose?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You've already used three rolls. I think that's enough. Adam wraps his hands one more time and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't. forget to put some over his mouth like the angel said. Adam pulls off a strip of tape and covers Edward's mouth with it. He pulls off another strip of tape and puts it o top of the first. .

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's enough Adam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Just one more to make sure it'll hold.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Give me the tape. Dad reaches his hand out behind him while he drives. Adam looks disappointed, but puts the tape in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (disappointed) You're welcome. Dad smiles in the rearview mirror at him, and puts the ta on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You did good tiger. Adam smiles proudly. Dad lodks over at Fenton, and frowns Fenton just stares ahead at the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is tied to a chair with his mouth covered in duct tape and dried blood in his hair. He opens his eyes and sees Dad standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Edward Maas? The man shakes his head yes, his eyes wide with fear and confusion. He moans something through the tape. Dad looks at Fenton who stands against the shed wall next to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think that's an innocent man there, don't you? Well, it's not. FENTON'S P.O.V. Dad walks over to Edward and puts his han on him. Dad jerks as though he's being shocked. Edward looks up at Dad, his eyes wide with fear. DAD'S P.O.V. Edward sits in.a living room, watching a sit Over the sound of the television, there is a baby crying screen. On the couch next to him are two dead bodies, a m and a woman. He laughs hysterically at the sitcom, blendi with the baby's cries. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eT

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ADAM'S P.O.V. A bright shining light illuminates the shed Angels appear out of the light and circle Edward. Dad takes his hand off of him and steps back, seething wi rage.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Didn't think anyone knew about that did you!? He goes to the workbench and picks up the axe.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But God saw you. He moves closer to him, holding the axe with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (moves forward) Dad don't! Don't!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: And you can't escape God's wrath! He swings it straight at the man's head. Blood splatters Fenton's Charlie's Angels t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Fenton dig holes while Dad sits on the ground, smoking and watching Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I can't believe you still didn't see it. > Fenton looks up hatefully at him, but keeps digging.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was a murderer Fenton. He killed little babies! He gets up from the ground and tosses his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (upset) Babies. He walks off toward the house in the distance. Fenton sto digging and takes one of the black trash bags and dumps i in one of the holes. He stands over the hole and looks do at the bloody mess. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: He's the murderer. We've got to get out of here Adam. Adam looks over at him as he digs.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: We've got to run away. Remember I told you we might have to.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don't want to run away.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: We have to. Dad's crazy Adam. He's a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No he's not. He's a demon slayer.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That's all lies Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No it's not. I see it when he touches them. Fenton looks angrily at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: No you don't! Dad's brainwashed you. It's all a big lie. He's a murderer and you help him!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh! We're serving God's will! I'm gonna tell Dad on you. Fenton charges at Adam who drops his empty bag and runs o toward the house. The wind catches the empty bag and blow it into a rose bush where it snags on the thorns. Fenton falls to his knees and cries as Adam runs off. Blood drip from the empty bag onto a rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton comes in, looking exhausted. He enters the living room and finds Dad sitting in his recliner in the dark. They look at each other for a long moment, but neither sa anything. Fenton walks off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very early. Dad comes in fully dressed and shakes Fenton awake.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Get up and get dressed. And don't wake your brother. | Fenton watches him leave the room. He looks over at the clock and sees that it is 5:03 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton comes into the kitchen looking sleepy. Dad sits at the table sipping a cup of coffee. Dad looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Sit down. ' He takes the seat across from Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your brother told me what you said last night. I want you to know that I've never killed anything in my entire life Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That's a lie and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (sighs) When God asked me to destroy demons, I had to trust God's word that they really were demons. It was a question of faith. I've heard preachers call it the leap of faith. And I took that leap. I chose to believe. (beat) And when I did that, everything flipped over. And I ‘realized that it was the right thing. It was my destiny. Fenton just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did a lot of thinking and praying last night after you went to bed. I prayed for an angel to visit you. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yo CONTINUED: .

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But instead one visited me...and told me something I...I don't want to believe.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter because together you and I are going to prove him wrong. JI love you son. I don't ~ want anything to happen to you. Dad looks down at his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just don't have any faith. That's why you can't see the truth. {looks up at him) But we're going to change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is barely starting to come up. There is a glaze o dew over the grass. Dad comes out of the shed with Fenton following him, carrying a shovel. Dad walks out into the yard and looks around. He walks back toward the side of t shed and stops, looking at the ground. He motions for Fen and points at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I want you to dig a hole here. It'll need to be about twenty feet deep and about twenty feet wide in both directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton looks at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The length and width should form a ( perfect square.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Why! ? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ‘ Take that tone out of your voice. a Because I told you to. You might think I'm some crazed killer, but I'm still your father and you'll do what I tell you. You understand me? Fenton doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in a warning tone) Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Now, we're going to build ourselves a little cellar out here.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: A cellar?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yep. And until you give in to God's will and accept your place in this family, you're going to do most of the work by yourself.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I can't do that by myself. I don't even know how to build a cellar.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'll take care of that. All you have to do is the labor.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: All of it!?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yep. You're going to serve God's will one way or another. And God wants us to have a cellar to help us in our mission so get to work. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calls behind him) I want at least half that hole dug when I get home from work. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But Dad! I can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Pray. Maybe God will help you. Fenton watches him disappear around the side of the house and then looks down at the ground angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late morning now. The dew is gone and the sun blaze in the sky. Fenton digs the hole. It is about five feet wide and long, but only about two feet deep. There is a small pile of dirt by the hole. He is covered in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I started digging that goddamn hole, but I did not pray. I would not. I hated God. I despised Him. My hatred helped me dig. It kept me going. Dad's or God's or the angels' or whoever's plan it was would not work on me. I knew what Dad was doing was wrong and nothing was going to change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun beats down on Fenton as he digs diligently. His shirt is now off and tied around his head. His back is slightly sunburned. He is literally drenched in sweat. Th hole is about three feet deep, and about ten feet in leng and width. Fenton digs steadily, throwing dirt over his shoulder into the ever growing pile by the hole.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Fenton. Fenton keeps digging, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fenton! Fenton stops and looks up at his brother. He is holding a big plastic cup of water. He extends it to Fenton. Fenton takes it and gulps half of it down. Adam looks at the hol

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How big does it have to be?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Twenty feet long, wide and deep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wt  13
