dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (eyes wide) That's huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton puts the cup down and starts to shovel again. Adam watches him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I told on you. He stops digging and looks at Adam.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You didn't tell him what I said about running away, did you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Will you go with me then?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) There's no reason to go.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: He's a killer Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, he's not. Why can't you just believe? Dad said we could both help you dig the hole if you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton looks angry, but doesn't say anything. He begins t dig again.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've been praying for you. He digs faster, his anger mounting.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you been praying?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (snaps at him) Nope. And I'm not going to.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But Dad said that... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't care what Dad said! He might be able to make me dig this stupid hole, but he can't make me pray.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But maybe if we both pray God will show you the truth like he did for me and Dad. Fenton stops digging and looks sharply at him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You're as crazy as Dad. Just get out of here and leave me alone. Adam looks crushed. Fenton goes back to digging. Adam tur to go, but turns back.

dialogues.speaker: BDAM
dialogues.text: I'll help you if you promise you won't tell Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I don't want your help. He keeps digging.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But there's another shovel in the...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Get out of here! He throws dirt at him, and he runs off. Fenton watches hi run off, and frowns regretfully.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I wanted to run away, far away, but I still couldn't leave Adam no matter how crazy Dad was turning him. And besides, there was nowhere to go. Fenton goes back to digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is starting to go down. Fenton still digs, but a little slower than before. The hole is considerably deepe now, about five feet deep, but still about ten feet long wide. The dirt pile has grown considerably. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yo,

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Looks like you've been busy. Fenton looks up and sees Dad standing over the side of th hole.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ain't exactly half, but it's impressive. Pretty smart way to do it too. I wouldn't let it get much deeper before you start the other half though. - Fenton climbs out of the hole with the shovel, and starts dig at the edge of it to make it longer.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I'd say that's about enough for today. Come on in and I'll make us some supper. Looks like we've both had a long hard day. Fenton ignores him and keeps digging.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fenton. I said that's enough. Fenton keeps digging. Dad watches him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sighs) Well supper'll be waiting for you when you decide to come in. You did good today Fenton. He looks at Fenton for some sort of response, but gets no Fenton just keeps digging. Dad sighs again and walks off. Fenton never stops digging, an angry look of determinatio on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pitch dark out now. The only light is from the porc The hole is a little longer now. Fenton stops digging and puts the shovel down. He looks at the hole for a moment a then starts to walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton enters from the backdoor in the kitchen. He looks hungrily at the plate of cold food sitting on the table, walks past it. He walks down the hall and goes into the bathroom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: We The sound of the television playing and Dad and Adam laug is heard in the background. He turns on the faucet in the sink, wincing at the pain. His hands are a bloody mess of popped blisters. He puts them under the water and cries o softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton sits at the table, eating. It is hard for him to hold his fork and knife because of his blistered hands. D enters from the hallway and sees him at the table.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Finally gave up, huh kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I didn't give up. I'll be out there again in the morning. Dad frowns at him and sits down across from him at the ta

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that. Look, I don't want to fight with you son. I love you. I'm not doing this to hurt you. Fenton keeps eating, staring down at his plate.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish you could understand that. Fenton keeps eating. Dad watches him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you pray while you were out there?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (looks up defiantly) Nope. Dad frowns, but doesn't say anything. Fenton keeps eating but drops his knife loudly on the plate. He picks it up again, but it’s obvious he's in pain.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Let me see your hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo,

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: They're fine. Dad reaches out and pulls one of Fenton's hands out where can see it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Didn't you use gloves today? Fenton pulls his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I didn't need them. I'm fine. Dad gets up, goes to the kitchen cabinets, and gets some aspirin. He takes a couple out of the bottle and tries to hand them to Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Here. It'll ease the pain.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I said I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Fenton, I know you're mad at me, but that's no reason to cause yourself pain. Now take them. Fenton hesitates, but takes the pills and swallows them. Dad watches him with a concerned look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a pair of work gloves out in the shed.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: They've got blood on them.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I didn't mean those. There's some others. I want you to use them from now on. They won't do you any good now that you've wrecked your hands, but in a few days you'll be fine. Fenton keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You did good out there today Fenton. He tries to tousle his hair, but Fenton pulls away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you and I know God's proud of you. So take the next few days off. Let your hands heal, and then you can get back to it. Alright? Fenton doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (flatly) I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, good-night then. Fenton stares silently at his plate. Dad sighs and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is extremely early. The sun is just barely starting to come out. Fenton comes out of the house, walks out to the hole, and looks down at it. He takes the shovel from wher he left it the day before, and winces from the pain in hi hands. He slowly starts to dig in the dew covered grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is out, but it is still early morning. Fenton sti digs. The back screendoor creaks open and shuts in the distance. Fenton keeps digging. Dad walks up to the side of the hole and watches him for a few moments. Fenton not him, but doesn't look up or stop. Dad walks off. After a few moments, a pair of gloves hit him in the head He stops and looks in the direction of where the gloves c from, and sees Dad's back walking away. He looks at the gloves, and starts to dig again.

dialogues.speaker: , FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I kept digging. My hands hurt, but I wouldn't stop. The pain helped me keep going. It fed my hatred. I would never give in to Dad or his God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is going down. Fenton keeps digging. The hole and the pile of dirt beside it are both considerably larger. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I kept digging and Dad kept killing. Dad comes around the side of the house, carrying a person over his shoulder, with Adam following behind him. Fenton stops digging and watches them. Dad looks over at Fenton, their eyes lock for a moment, and then he disappears into the shed. Adam goes in and shuts the door behind then.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But he left me alone. Fenton goes back to digging.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I kept at it morning, noon, and night for five days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton stands on the edge of the giant hole, looking down into it.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And by the sixth day, it was as dark and deep as my hatred for Dad's God. Dad walks up from behind Fenton, and peers down at the ho

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well you finished it alright. Fenton just stares down at the hole.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I bet you didn't pray once the whole time. Did you? Fenton looks up at Dad, defiant and proud.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Nope. Dad looks at him wearily and then back down at the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is parked way up in the driveway near the backyar The side door of the van is open and there are stacks of wood inside of it. Adam and Fenton take wood from the van to the backyard where Dad is in the hole, using a hoe to smooth out the ground. They stack the wood next to the ho (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We started the cellar after that. At least that's what Dad called it, but I knew better. We were building a dungeon down there. Fenton stacks the wood and stares down at Dad in the hole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the beginnings of a wooden cellar in the hole. Dad, Adam, and Fenton hammer away.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't much of a cellar though or even a dungeon. Dad was definitely no architect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cellar has a roof now.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We basically built a big wooden box in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a lantern, but it is still somewhat dark. Fenton and Adam help Dad build a stairway that leads up to the t of the hole to an opened hatch where sunlight floods in.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But Dad said it would hold. God would see to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam and Dad stand on the ground, shoveling di onto the cellar, covering it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The makeshift support beams creak, but hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cellar is completely covered up with packed dirt, exc for the hatch. Fenton and Adam come in and out of the she taking things out of it, and putting them in the yard. Da packs the dirt some more with the back of a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move the shed, with Dad on one side and Fenton and A on the other, and position it over the cellar hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Fenton and Dad put stuff back in the shed. Dad looks around, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You did good boys. Especially you Fenton. Fenton ignores him and keeps arranging things. Dad frowns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Adam sit in the living room watching Happy Day on television. Dad's van is heard pulling up in the drive Adam jumps up and runs to the front door to greet him, bu Fenton doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The next night he brought home another demon. Fenton hears Dad come in and Adam greet him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey tiger. Where's your brother?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Watching tv.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fenton! Fenton stays where he is and doesn’t say a word. He hears Dad's footsteps coming down the front hall.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fenton! ? Fenton looks at the entryway to the living room, and sees Dad standing there, holding a TEENAGE GUY over his should his hands and feet tied together with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fenton, you answer me when I call you. Come out to the cellar. Fenton stares at him stubbornly, and doesn't move. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sternly) Now. Fenton gets up angrily, and Dad turns to walk away. When does, Fenton sees the teenager's terrified face. There ar tears in his eyes and duct tape over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad puts the teenager down on the floor. Adam holds the lantern, looking at him curiously. The teenager looks bac at Adam and seems to calm down a little. Fenton hangs bac on the steps. Dad notices hin.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Get down here. Fenton does as he's told, though slowly. Dad peels off hi gloves and picks up the axe from the corner of the room. walks toward Fenton, and extends the axe to him. Fenton looks at it, but doesn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sternly) It has to be done. It's God's will. He extends the axe to Fenton again.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now do it like I showed you. The neck first. The teenager squirms and moans on the floor. Fenton looks from him to Dad to the axe, and then runs back up the ste

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fenton! Get back here! Fenton! Dad hears the shed door slam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'll do it Dad. He looks at Adam and then at the teenager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton runs away from the house quickly, and breaks into sprint once he hits the gravel road. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I had tried to save Adam and Dad, but they wouldn't let me. So the only thing left to do was to save myself. The stars shine down on him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I half expected angels or even God himself to come out of the night and stop me. But I had to do it. I had ~ to put an end to the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton runs up to the station and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton runs in, panting. The place is empty.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (looks around) Hello? No one answers. Fenton walks through the place, looking increasingly worried.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello! Hello!? There is no one there.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (screams in panic) Hello!!! A door opens down the hall, and DEPUTY SMALLS sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: I'm in the bathroom for christ's sake! I'll be there in a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Smalls sits at his desk looking at Fenton who sits across from him. .

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: That's the craziest shit I've ever heard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: a, What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: Calling your dad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You can't!

dialogues.speaker: ' DEPUTY SMALLS --
dialogues.text: Oh yes I can. You should be ashamed of yourself, making up stories like that about your own father.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But it's true! I can show you. Deputy Smalls looks at him for a long moment and then han up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: Come on. He gets up and Fenton follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patrol car pulls up to the house and parks. All the lig to the house are off. Fenton and Deputy Smalls get out.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: It's around back, under the shed.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: (grabs Fenton's arm) That's enough of that boy. We're gonna put an end to this. Come on. He pulls him towards the porch.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But he's in the back.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: Let's see what your Dad has to say. about all this. They reach the porch and Deputy Smalls knocks on the door They wait for a long moment, and then the door opens to r Dad in his underwear, looking confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Bo

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Meeks, I'm sorry to bother you so late and all, but... oN od He indicates Fenton. Dad sees him and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Smalls sits at the table with Fenton next to him. Dad, now in a pair of blue-jeans, pours Deputy Smalls a g of ice-tea and hands it to hin.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, that is quite a tale alright. Makes me cringe to think he told lies like that to everyone down at the police station.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: They're not lies and you know it! Smalls looks uncomfortable at Fenton's outburst.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: Well, you can put your mind at ease about that. I was the only one there and of course... (looks hard at Fenton) I don't believe a word of it, but what got me is why in the world he'd make something like that up. That's why I brought him over here myself.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (sighs) I don't know why he made it up. Probably to get back at me for punishing him earlier. (to Fenton) Did you tell him about that?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (to Smalls) He's lying. Just check the shed. Smalls looks to Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: : Sie

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They hit puberty and lose all respect for you. You ask me, you should take a switch to him. Smalls gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I've always tried to avoid it, but... Fenton jumps up and grabs Small's arm.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Check the shed! Or the Rose Garden! I can show you where they're buried! Smalls looks to Dad. Dad shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Maybe you should check the shed.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: I know there's nothing out there. (to Fenton) And so do you.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, it won't hurt none. Maybe even calm him down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: If you think we should...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: If it has to be done, it has to be done. (looks hard at Fenton) What do you think kiddo? Does it have to be done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton leads Smalls to the shed with Dad following behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton throws open the door and rushes to the hatch which unlocked, and pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: See!? Smalls looks at the hatch and then to Dad, who shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Figured we ought to have a storm cellar. Dad takes a lantern off of his workbench and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on down and check it out. He hands the lantern to Smalls.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just watch your step. I'm not much of a carpenter. Smalls takes the lantern and follows Fenton down into the dark cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Smalls make it to the bottom of the steps. The lantern slowly fills the cellar with dim light. It is emp

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: Just like I thought. Fenton looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But he was here!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: If I was your Dad I'd bust your butt good for this one.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: They must have moved him. He was here. Adam! Adam's got him somewhere!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY SMALLS
dialogues.text: I've had about enough of this for one night. Smalls hands Fenton the lantern and starts climbing the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Wait! I can show you where the bodies are buried! Smalls stops, looks back at him, frowns and shakes his he and then turns back and continues up the stairs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: oF

dialogues.speaker: . FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Please! You've got to believe me! Smalls reaches the top of the stairs and then suddenly fa back and rolis down the steps. He lands at the bottom wit a thud. Fenton runs to him and sees the blood flowing fro the huge gash in his chest. He is still alive. He looks down at his wound, confused, and then up at Fenton. He tr to say something, but can't form the words. There are FOOTSTEPS on the stairs. Fenton looks up and sees Dad com down the steps with the axe in his hand. Fenton moves bac in fear. Dad reaches the bottom of the stairs and looks a the dazed Deputy who is looking right back at him. He lif the axe, but there are tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: May God welcome you and keep you. He brings the axe down. Smalls' legs twitch a little and then stop. Dad throws the bloody axe to the floor, and then turns and vomits. Fenton watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton digs a hole as Dad sits on the ground, wiping tear from his eyes. Smalls' body lays on the ground a few feet away from Dad. Adam also digs a hole a little further away from them. Be Adam there are three black trashbags. He finishes his fir hole, dumps the contents of one of the trashbags into it, and then starts to dig another hole. Fenton finishes his hole, sticks his shovel in the ground and looks at Dad who is still crying, though silently. Da notices Fenton, and looks away.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I never killed a man until tonight.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON ,
dialogues.text: I've seen you kill plenty. Dad looks up hard at Fenton, and there is hate for the fi time in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Those were demons you heathen! Demons! Adam stops digging and looks over at them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {points to the corpse) That was a man! Not a demon! Why can't you see that?! What's wrong with you?! Why can't you see it?!

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You didn't have to kill hin.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I had to protect our mission. I told you what would happen if you teld! But you told anyway!

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: There is no mission! You're crazy! Dad jumps up and goes for Fenton. Fenton tries to back up but is too slow. Dad grabs him by the arms.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (cries) Dad don't!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That man is dead because of you! Dead because you have no faith! Don't you understand what you've done! ?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything! He pulls him into his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You've made me a murderer Fenton! A murderer! He throws Fenton to the ground. He grabs the shovel and raises it above his head. Adam screams. Fenton covers his head, readying himself for the blow. Dad holds the shovel his face dark with rage. He lets out a cry, throws the sh to the ground, and collapses on the ground sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God help me. Help me God. Please help me. Adam goes to him and puts an arm around him. Fenton watch him cry without any emotion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It's alright Dad. Don't cry. co Fenton gets up and pushes Smalls' body into the hole. iu looks at Fenton and frowns. Fenton starts to cover him with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton walks across the road from the garden, carrying hi shovel. Dad and Adam follow behind him. The patrol car is still parked in front of the house. Fenton reaches the ho before them, and starts to climb the porch steps. Dad loo at the patrol car and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (calls to Fenton) Wait a minute Fenton. Dad and Adam walk up to him on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Adam} Go on inside son. I'll be there in a minute to tuck you in. Adam looks at Dad then at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. It's alright. You did good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam smiles weakly at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It was easy. (to Fenton) I destroyed a demon.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (rubs his head) You sure did tiger. Adam passes Fenton on the steps and goes inside the house Dad watches him go and then turns to Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on around back to the shed. He walks off, and after a moment Fenton follows him. Ao

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is open. Dad stands at his workbench, cleaning o the axe blade with a rag. Fenton walks into the doorway, but lingers there when he sees Dad with the axe.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Come inside and shut the door. Fenton hesitates for a moment, and then does as he is tol Dad looks up at him, sees the fear.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you afraid? Fenton nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (beat) You.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Only demons should fear me. He takes a step toward Fenton, holding the axe casually.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're not a demon. (beat) Are you? Fenton backs up a step, eyeing the axe.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The angel said you were. Fenton looks at him with new terror.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That night before I had you dig the hole. Said you were a demon down deep. That me and Adam couldn't see it, but that we would in time. Said it was why you wouldn't help us. They stare at each other for a long moment. Dad tosses th axe to the side of the shed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: az

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I don't believe that. I...1 just can't. You're my son, and I love you more than my own life. Fenton visibly relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what's funny about this situation Fenton? I'm afraid of you. He walks to the cellar hatch, bends down on his knees, an opens it. He looks down into the darkness of the cellar with a frown.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't understand you, and that scares me. I can't trust you, and that scares me even more. You're the only part of this whole thing that doesn't make sense to me. He straightens himself and looks over at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. Get down there. Dad nods to the steps. Fenton looks down into the dark cellar, and then at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this Fenton, but I have to after tonight. I had to kill a man because of you. I won't let that happen again.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I promise I won't tell again.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I can't trust you. I wish I could, but I can't. Now go on.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Please Dad, I'm sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry too, Son. (sternly) Now go on before I put you down there myself.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But...but it’s dark down there.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I don't have time to argue. I've still got to clean up the mess you - caused tonight. Now go on.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Let me take the lantern.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (shakes his head no) Go. Fenton makes a run for it, but Dad grabs him by the arn, picks him up, and carries him down the opened hatch as he kicks and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad puts him down at the bottom of the steps. He tries to run up the steps, but Dad pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You'll stay down here until you see the truth. Dad walks quickly up the stairs. Fenton scrambles toward the hatch, but Dad closes it on him, leaving him in total darkness. He beats his fists on the hatch door, crying.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! Please Dad! Please! He hears Dad put the pad lock on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.5S.)
dialogues.text: Pray for a vision son. Only God can show you the truth. Pray to Him Fenton. Only He can help you now. . He hears Dad walk off, and the shed door shut behind him. Fenton collapses on the steps in tears. He wraps his arms around himself, and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ae

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam opens the shed door and comes in carrying a big cup. He goes to the hatch door, puts the cup on it, and gets o his hands and knees beside it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to the hatch) Fenton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is completely dark except for a few tiny shafts of lig around the hatch door. Fenton lays underneath the hatch door, curled up on the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fenton? He stirs and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fenton? You alright? Fenton moves closer to the hatch and tries to see through the cracks, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (rasps) Adam. Get me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Please, Adam. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dad says you have to stay down there until God shows you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: But I'm hungry and I've got to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dad won't let me feed you. He-says it'll help you find God. He called it fasting. I brought you some water though. He said you can have a cup a day, but I'll bring more if I can. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: He's going to kill me Adam. You've got to let me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “ I can't. Adam picks up the cup.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your mouth by the crack. Here. He pours a little water on the crack. The water trickles down it and into the cellar. Fenton puts his mouth by it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready? Here. He pours more of the water into the crack. Fenton drinks from the trickle, and let's it wet his face. “ADAM (CONT'D) You want some more or you want me to save it for later?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: More. He gradually pours the rest of the cup down the crack and Fenton drinks it.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got to let me out of here Adam. Adam doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Adam?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I've been praying for you Fenton. We both have. Dad says that you'll probably be out of there by the end of the week. You just have to accept God's will. :

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (panicked) I can't stay in here that long! Let me out! Ss (CONTINUED) 45  — TO ———— eS wr co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Ye He beats on the hatch door and Adam backs up from it, tea forming in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry. He walks away from the hatch door. Fenton hears him walki out and beats harder.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Adam! Please don't go! Please! He hears the shed door shut, and breaks down into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain beats down on the car. Doyle drives as Fenton si in the backseat. FENTON . The days came and went. I counted them by the cracks of light in the hatch door, and Adam's visits with water. My fear never lessened. I even pissed and shit myself because ' I was too afraid to leave my little spot by the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: That's awful.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: The hunger and the stink helped me forget the fear for awhile, but it always came crashing back. You would have thought that I would have eventually gotten over my fear of the dark, but I didn't. I was terrified the entire time. I only slept when I passed out from exhaustion and fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: What about your Dad? Did he ever come back to at least check on you?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: On the seventh day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch door opens and light shines down into the darkn revealing Fenton laying in his spot. He lifts his head we and squints at the figure standing above the hatch, looki down at him. Dad's face is filled with misery as he looks at his son.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Has God spoken to you yet? Fenton tries to stand, but falls back down. He lifts his head up and looks Dad right in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (rasps) There is no God. Dad stands there for a long moment, looking sadly at Fent He shuts the hatch and the light disappears into total darkness. The sound stops. There is no light or sound at all. There is nothing but pitch black darkness.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I lost count of the days after that. It felt like weeks. I finally went beyond fear into total insanity. I saw God. He had finally sent me a vision alright. It was like that line in Acts, "Immediately something like scales fell from Saul's eyes and he could see again." And it was then that I understood my destiny just like Dad had said I would. There is a SPLASH sound, and light from the opened hatch falls on Fenton. He is drenched and laughing hysterically Dad is shaking him, and calling his name.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (worried) Fenton! Fenton! Adam stands at the top of the stairs crying. Suddenly Fen stops laughing. Dad and Adam both freeze. There is a perf moment of silence. Fenton looks up at Dad and smiles weak

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: {croaks) I saw God Dad. Dad looks at him for a long moment, and a big smile sprea slowly over his face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo, CONTINUED: as He pulls Fenton to him, tears of joy in his eyes, and car his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank you God. Thank you. Adam jumps up and down with excitement, clapping his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton, now cleaned up and in fresh clothes, sits at the kitchen table eating a plate of food. Dad and Adam watch him as he devours the food.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (smiles) Slow down there. You don't want to make yourself sick. Fenton tries to slow down a little, but can't help himsel

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (excited) . So did God tell you about the demons? Fenton nods with his mouthful. Dad smiles proudly.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I doubted you Dad. Dad reaches out and tousles his hair.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry too son. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What'd God look like?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: It's hard to describe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Was he big?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Adam, leave him alone. He can't tell you something like that. You have to see it for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But I want to know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Then maybe you should pray for it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (pouting) It's not fair. All I've seen are angels and he gets to see God.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Look at the price he paid for it though. Dad looks at Fenton devouring his food. He almost frowns, but forces a smile instead.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that's all behind us now. This is a new day. Isn't it. Fenton? Fenton smiles and nods with his mouthful.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So we gonna go get us a demon now?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: After awhile. When Fenton's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives. A ballgame plays softly on the radio. Fenton sits in the passenger seat, looking at a map. Adam sits i the back.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A week later I was ready. I remember it was a Friday night near the very end of summer. My first demon was to be Brad White from Dallas. Fenton puts down the map and looks through the windshield the lights and buildings of downtown Dallas in the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van drives slowly down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives looking at the numbers on the houses. Fenton points at one.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: There it is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is a small house with a beat-up car sitting in the driveway. Dad pulls the van down the street, turns around and parks by the curb. They all three stare at the house. Dad turns on his flashers and looks over at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You sure you're ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (solemnly) Yes sir. Dad smiles at him, and puts on his gloves. He pulls out a second pair of gloves and hands them to Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I've been saving them for you. You might need them now that God has spoken to you. Fenton takes them and puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, let's go. He reaches between the seats and pulls out the lead pipe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I want to go, too.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Not this time Adam. Adam looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry your time will come. Dad and Fenton open their doors and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton and Dad walk up to the porch. The porch-light is off, but there is a light on inside, and a television can heard. They reach the front door. Dad knocks. They hear someone moving around inside and coming to the door. Fent looks up at Dad who smiles reassuringly. A man in his mid thirties, BRAD WHITE, opens the door, and looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Yeah? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: tol

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you, but we've got a flat tire. He points to the van with its flashers going. Brad looks out and. sees it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you had a tire iron. I went off and left mine at home. Brad looks at Dad and then at Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: What's with the gloves?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: To change the tire.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: (smirks) Don't want to get your hands dirty?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Brad! Who is it? Brad turns and shouts back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Mind your business bitch! Brad turns back to them and gives Dad a look.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn women. Dad forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I got one for you. He walks out and shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. It's around back. Fenton and Dad follow him off the porch and around the ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad walks up to the garage and opens the door. There is stuff all over the place inside of it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: fez

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Now let's see. He flicks on a light and starts to rummage through the pl Dad watches him and slowly pulls the pipe from his back. Fenton looks over and sees a hammer laying on the floor. Dad gets behind Brad and raises the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it is. Just as Dad is about to bring it down on his head, Fenton accidentally knocks over something, and Brad looks up and sees Dad with the pipe. He dodges, and Dad misses him.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! Brad brings the tire iron up and hits Dad in the stomach. Dad doubles over. He raises the tire iron to hit Dad agai but cries out in pain and grabs the back of his neck. He turns and sees Fenton holding the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You little son of a bitch! He raises the tire iron, but suddenly falls forward revea Dad with the pipe. Dad holds his stomach in pain and look at Brad unconscious on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Grab his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drives down the highway. Fenton sits in the passenger seat staring out the window. Adam is in the back taping Brad's hands and legs. He finishes and slaps an extra pie of tape over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: All done. Dad turns to look and winces. Fenton notices.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Is it good and tight?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (to Dad) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Maybe some bruised ribs, but I'll live. If it wasn't for you, it could've been worse. We might not have got him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I thought God was supposed to protect _ us.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: He did. (smiles proudly) God was working through you tonight kiddo. Fenton looks back at Brad out cold on the floorboard.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to admit I was a little worried earlier, but now I know everything is going to be alright. I'm proud of you Fenton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up in the driveway. Fenton gets out and ope the side door. Adam is asleep, but Brad is awake. He look right at Fenton. Dad comes around the side of the van and sees that Brad is awake. He puts on his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Let's get him in the cellar. (to Adam) Adam, wake up. He reaches in and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on Adam. Wake up. Adam mumbles and turns over. Dad looks at him sleeping an smiles. :

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Might as well let him sleep. We'll get him later. Dad reaches for Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ao,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad drops Brad on the floor. Fenton hangs back on the ste holding the lantern and the axe. Dad steps back from Brad exhausted and holding his stomach. He looks over at Fento

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You know son, I've been waiting for this moment ever since all this started. Fenton sets the lantern down and steps forward with the a looking at Brad.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I'm ready to fulfill my destiny. Dad looks at Fenton, smiles, and walks over to Brad on th floor, peeling off his gloves. Brad watches Dad and says something muffled by the tape.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: {looks to Fenton) You ready? Fenton nods and moves forward next to Dad. Dad kneels dow next to Brad and grabs him by the arm. Dad's eyes go wide and so do Brad's. Adam walks down the stairs, sees Dad wi his hands on the demon, and his eyes widen. Fenton lifts the axe, a look of determination on his face. Dad lets go of Brad with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (outraged) Destroy him! Fenton swings the axe. Brad's eyes widen with shock. Dad falls back onto the floor with the axe buried in his ches Adam screams and runs down the steps. Dad looks at Fenton with pain.

dialogues.speaker: DAD., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How...could you...do this? Fenton stares at him coldly. Tears fall from Dad's eyes. Adam rushes to Dad's side, crying. Dad puts an arm around Adam, pulls him close, says something to him, -and dies. Fenton watches him die, and then turns to Brad and pulls tape off of his mouth. Brad looks past him and screams. Fenton turns to see Adam with the axe raised above his he Fenton falls back and closes his eyes and the picture fad to black as Brad screams. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne  ———eea_—a_=_ew of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: toh CONTINUED: . Fenton opens his eyes and sees Adam on the floor, cradlin Dad's limp head, crying. Adam sees Fenton looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (crying) You killed him! You killed Dad! He's dead! He's deeeeeaaaad! He cries uncontrollably as Fenton watches him without emo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle drives. Fenton sits in the backseat. They drive alo in silence. There are tears in Fenton's eyes. He looks ou the window at the rain, and wipes at his tears. Doyle gla at Fenton in the rearview.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You had to do it, you know. He was a mad dog. He had to be put down. Fenton stares out the window, and doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what happened then?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I buried him in the Rose Garden. He doesn't say anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You didn't tell anybody?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: We went to the sheriff about a week later, right before school started and told him that Dad hadn't come home one day. Doyle waits for him to continue, but he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (sighs) . The sheriff filled out a missing persons report, but never found anything. We were sent to separate orphanages after awhile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Joe

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: He didn't suspect anything? I mean his deputy disappears a month or so before and he didn't suspect anything?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Maybe he did. I don't know. He never questioned us about any of it. He looks back out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So no one ever knew about any of it?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Nope. Not until now.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: But what about Adam...

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we just sit here for awhile? I don't feel like talking anymore. Doyle looks frustrated, but doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped and the sun is beginning to come out though it is still very early. Doyle’s car drives down th empty road in front of the Rose Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle drives as Fenton looks out the window at the garden

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Pull over here. Doyle pulls the car over. Fenton yawns.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (yawns) Where's the house?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: They tore it down almost ten years ago. Let me out. Doyle gets out and opens the backdoor for him. He reaches in to give him a hand, but Fenton refuses. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself out of the car with the handcuffs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter through a narrow gap in the chain link fence n the back of the garden. Fenton walks off through the wet weeds to a small, barely noticeable path. Doyle follows.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (as they walk) It's a little further back this way.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: But this isn't even in the garden. He points to the garden in the distance where rosebushes lined up in neat symmetrical rows in front of the Rose Mu

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I said it was near the back. They continue to walk, the garden proper disappearing beh them as they enter a thicket of trees.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You know, you never told me what the promise was. The one you made to your brother. Fenton looks over at him, but keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: It was later that night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton digs a hole. Adam sits on the ground next to Dad's corpse, holding him and crying. Fenton finishes digging t hole, and walks over to the corpse. Adam looks up at him angrily with tears in his eyes. Fenton pulls Dad away fro Adam and drags him into the hole. He picks up the shovel and starts to fill the hole. Adam stands over the hole watching Dad being slowly covered with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton packs the dirt on the ground and then looks at Ada who is glaring at him with hatred. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: If you ever destroy me Adam, promise me you'll bury me here. Adam glares at hin.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I promise to God I'll bury you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle and Fenton are still walking, though the woods have become thicker.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I don't understand. He promised you that he would bury you here?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (confused) If he ever killed you?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Not killed. Destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Doyle stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That doesn't make sense. Fenton stops and turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: It does if the man in front of you is Adam Meeks and not Fenton Meeks.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You heard me. It might take you a few seconds, but you'll get it. Ss (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares at him for a moment and then goes for his gu Adam stands calmly where he is, watching him. Doyle raise the gun and levels it on him.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: {still confused) So you're the killer?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. I told you before. I've never killed anyone in my life. Fenton was the killer.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Stop playing games and tell me the truth!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: The game is over. You'll understand soon. Just let me show you where I buried Fenton. We're almost there. He points to a clearing up ahead. Doyle looks unsure, but nods after a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You take it slow or I swear to God I'll shoot you. Adam smiles at him and starts to slowly walk in the direc of the clearing. Doyle follows, keeping the gun aimed at him. They reach the large clearing where a few giant rosebushes stand.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: This is it. This is the spot. There are literally dozens and dozens of spots on the gro where the grass has been uprooted and holes have been dug and filled in. The covered holes are all in little cluste of threes. Adam points to one of the fresher clusters, wh a shovel lays next to it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's where I buried him. Doyle studies the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: There's too many holes here. There were only six victims. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Wo

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: God's work is never done. Fenton didn't bury his victims here. He “™ kept them as trophies in his basement. : This is where I put demons. Doyle looks at him, but Adam stares at Fenton's three gra

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That night I went to Fenton's house was the first time I had seen him since we were kids. I didn't even ~- know he lived so close to me until he showed up on my list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the same house from the very beginning. All the lig to the house are off except for a dim light in the front window. Johnny Cash's Peace in the Valley plays softly fr inside the house. Adam stands in the driveway, holding a lead pipe in his gloved hand, looking at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton (previously Adam) sits at a small desk in the corn of the living room, typing on an old typewriter. The song plays on an old record player on the other side of the ro He hums along with it as he types. On ‘the desk there are two stacks of paper. Taped to the wall in front of the de are several newspaper clippings from the God's Hand case a single piece of paper with seven names on it, six of th crossed out. Fenton pulls the piece of paper out of the typewriter, puts it on top of one of the stacks of paper, takes another sheet from the other stack, puts it in the typewriter, and starts to type again.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fenton Meeks. Fenton whirls around barely in time to see Adam bringing pipe down on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenton lays on the floor with his hands and feet taped. There is a trickle of blood on his forehead. Adam leans o the desk, the axe next to him, watching him. Fenton opens his eyes, dazed, tries to move, but can't. He looks aroun and sees Adam. He looks at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: So you finally came for me.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: God finally came for you.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I knew this day would come.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I've prayed for the past twenty years that it wouldn't, but I guess I knew it too.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: Dad would be so proud of you. You always were his favorite. You even look kind of like him, you know it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (not looking at him) Why did you leave the notes?

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: To lure you to me and get this whole thing over with once and for all. 1 just couldn't take it anymore. I like to be the hunter not the hunted. I knew when those killings made the news, you'd track me down. I have to admit though, I didn't expect you to wait so long. Six people. You let six people die before you came after me.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I came only when God put you on my ist. To come before then would have been murder.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: You might call it something else, but you're a murderer just like me. The only difference is you kill for God and I kill because I like it. The look in their eyes as they die, the way the blood feels on my flesh. It makes me feel good.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Did killing Dad make you feel good? (CONTINUED)
eo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: ye

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: (half sings) It put that joy joy joy joy down in my heart. Adam looks away from him, fighting his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon Adam, you're supposed to say where remember? Adam pulls off one of his gloves. _.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess that's not your favorite song anymore. Fenton looks at Adam's bare hand, and smiles sadistically

dialogues.speaker: FENTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember the look in Dad's eyes that night?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember. Adam takes off his other glove and tosses them both down the desk. Fenton watches him.

dialogues.speaker: FENTON
dialogues.text: I should have killed you when I first got to town, but that was too easy. I had to have you come for me. (laughs bitterly) I guess I forgot that God protects you. But he didn't protect all those people I killed in the past twenty years. And he sure didn't protect Dad, did he? Adam walks around Fenton, takes a roll of tape out of his pocket, and tears off a big piece.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: God asked Dad to destroy his own son much like he asked Isaac to sacrifice his own son to test his faith. But. Dad couldn't do it. He loved his son, demon or not. He reaches down and slaps the tape on Fenton's mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He simply could not do what God had asked of hin. He walks to the desk and picks up the axe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And God didn't take pity on Dad like he did with Isaac. He walks back over to Fenton and looks him right in the e

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that was back at a time when God had pity. Adam reaches a hand out toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stares at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: (softly) Jesus Christ, you really do believe all that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I've always believed.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I told you my instincts were always right. I knew there was something about you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So you think you've finally figured out what I've been hiding all this time? Do you know my secret? Doyle looks at him for a long moment and shakes his head disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You're insane, you know that Fenton. or Adam or whoever you are? And these little stories you've been telling me all night are just as crazy. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I honestly don't care which ones are true and which ones aren't. Maybe I'll figure that out later, maybe not. But right this minute all I need to know is that you're a sick murderer and I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Maybe, but that's not going to bring back your mother is it? She's dead and her killer got away. Didn't he? -_ Doyle looks hard at him and he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You son of a... He rushes at him. Adam puts out his handcuffed hands and touches Doyle right as he gets close enough. Doyle stops and both of their eyes go wide. .

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Doyle drops the gun in a daze. Adam quickly reaches into Doyle's pocket, takes out his keys, and un-handcuffs hims

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dazed) How...how did you do that? Adam reaches out and grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Adam turns him around, puts the handcuffs on him, and let him go. .

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How..how did you know? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: God knew. You were on my list. That's why I brought you out here. Adam pushes him towards one of the rosebushes.

dialogues.speaker: INTO HER
dialogues.text: Adam bends down and picks up the axe that is hidden under the bush, and pushes him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...behind the bush where there is a freshly dug hole. Doy falls into the hole. He seems to snap out of it and his eyes widen in fear when he sees Adam standing over him wi the axe. He struggles to stand.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You...You can't do this! I'm...I'm an FBI agent. They'll come looking for me!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No they won't. They'll keep looking for Fenton. You're going to be his last victim. God has willed it.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: But...but you've been seen! They'll know it was you! Adam knocks him back down with his foot, and lifts the ax

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: God will protect me. He brings the axe down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drives Doyle's car down the highway, turning the rad dial until he finds an old country and western station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam pulls into the parking lot next to the ambulance, an gets out of the car. He gets into the ambulance, starts i and pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operator sits at her desk still reading the novel fro earlier. The phone rings, and as she reaches for it a fol piece of paper falls out of the book. She answers the pho transfers the call, and then unfolds the paper. She reads the typed words, "God's hand has taken William Doyle." He eyes widen. She drops the paper on her desk and grabs the phone. ‘Next to the piece of paper is the book. The cover has a picture of single red rose with the title Frailty a it, and the words by Fenton Meeks underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drives down the highway singing with the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is buzzing with activity now. Agents come and g down the hallway. Inside one of the offices, Agent Hull, the operator, and TWO AGENTS are gathered around a video monitor. Hull fast-forwards the tape until he sees someth He stops it and pushes play.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: There he is. The monitor shows a man walking into the reception area, it is impossible to make out his face. He moves out of fr Hull fast-forwards again until the man walks back into fr He lets it play, and the man walks to the operator, gives her the book, and then turns toward the camera.

dialogues.speaker: HULL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got him now. As the man turns toward the camera there is a glitch and moves out of frame without revealing his face.

dialogues.speaker: HULL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! He rewinds, watches it again, but the glitch is still the

dialogues.speaker: HULL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Are you sure neither one of you can remember what he looked like? The operator and Hull both shake their heads. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: I told you it's just a blur. I can't understand it. I looked right at him, shook his hand.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2
dialogues.text: Well, we're running the name he gave you now.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: It's got to be a fake name.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2
dialogues.text: Maybe. Pretty weird one though. Fenton Meeks? The operator looks up.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Fenton Meeks? That's the name on the book! The one I found the note in. All the agents look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several FBI agents position themselves around the house. Hull gives the signal and they storm the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull comes in after the other agents have secured the pla and walks through the house. He walks to the desk and loo down at the old typewriter, phonebooks, and the stacks of papers next to it. He reads the top page. It reads "God's hand has taken Karen Levy.”

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. He flips through the other papers and they all have the s thing typed on them except the names are different on eac one. He notices the list taped on the wall, but this time all seven names are crossed out on it. He pulls it off th wall and sees that the last name is William Doyle as one the agents walks up to him, carrying something.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: There's no one here sir. We found this in the basement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KT
dialogues.text: SASS ARSC Q(B A¢ AI S"""CCw ttt ————— CONTINUED: us He holds it out in his plastic-gloved hand and reveals th it is a bloody wallet with Doyle's picture ID on one side and his badge on the other. There is a blood stain on the _ picture. Hull frowns.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Is...is he down there too?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door near the far wall is opened, revealing a set of steps that lead down. Hull goes down the stairs. The othe agents in the kitchen watch him.

dialogues.speaker: HULL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yells in disgust) Jesus Christ! The other agents shuffle uncomfortably as they hear him v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Hull enters and walks up to the reception desk. A woman is turned, filing something.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The woman turns and we see that it is the same pregnant b woman that Doyle spoke to earlier on the phone. She smile

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I didn't even hear you come in. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: I'm with the FBI. I need to speak to the sheriff, is he in?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swivels around in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sheriff! {back to Hull) You want some coffee or something?- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: wo™ No I'm fine. Thanks. Officer Henderson comes in from the front door. Hull turn to him and they nod hello at each other. Hull turns back the sound of a door opening and sees Adam, dressed in a p uniform, come out of the office. Surprisingly, there is absolutely no recognition in Hull's eyes or in Adam's.

dialogues.speaker: HULL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sheriff Meeks?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yes? They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: I'm Agent Hull of the FBI. I need to ask you some questions about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Fenton? Hull nods solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull walks out the door of the station followed by Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, I appreciate you coming by to tell me personally. I...I don't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: It's got to be hard. I just wanted you to know before we go public.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well if there's anything I can do...

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: I think we've got it pretty well covered from here. But again if you can think of where he might have gone or if he contacts you... Ss Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oe CONTINUED: (20. He extends his hand and Adam shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: _ Take care sheriff. Hull tries to pull his hand away, but Adam holds it for a brief moment and looks him right in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're a good man Agent Hull. Hull looks at him strangely but smiles, and Adam lets go his hand. Hull gets into his car, starts it, and drives : off. Adam watches as he pulls away. The woman comes out.

dialogues.speaker: ROMAN
dialogues.text: Adam? Is everything okay? He turns and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Everything's fine Mary. He goes to her and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God's will has been served. AE She smiles at him. He reaches down and caresses her pr Se stomach.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Praise God. A beam of light shines down on them from the heavens abov
